clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Splint for Osteoarthritis of the Trapeziometacarpal Joint
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Effectiveness of a Functional Splint for Osteoarthritis of the Trapeziometacarpal Joint on the Dominant Hand: A Randomized Controlled Study

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: Forty participants were enrolled in a randomized, controlled clinical trial to evaluate the effectiveness of a functional thumb splint for trapeziometacarpal OA in the dominant hand.

detailed_description.textblock: Treatment, Randomized, Single Blind, Placebo Control, Parallel Assignment, Efficacy Study

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (T0), after 45 days (T45), after 90 dias (T90) and after 180 dias (T180)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (T0), after 45 days (T45), after 90 dias (T90) and after 180 dias (T180)

intervention.description: Patients in the study group received the splint on the day of the first evaluation and took it with them for use during activities of daily living and patients in the control group only used the splint during the evaluations

responsible_party.organization: UNIFESP - Universidade Federal de Sao Paulo
